meanings.definition: A substance added to another substance in order to alter or improve it.
meanings.sent1: The chef used an additive to enhance the flavor of the soup.
meanings.sent2: The food scientist studied the effects of different additives on the texture of ice cream.
meanings.sent3: The additive in the paint made it glow in the dark, much to the surprise of the artist.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like an additive that brought warmth to every interaction.
meanings.sent5: The additive in the shampoo made her hair shine like never before.

meanings.sent1: The new ingredient was not only tasty but also additive to the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle had an additive piece that could be used to extend its size.
meanings.sent3: His enthusiasm was so additive that it spread to everyone around him.
meanings.sent4: The music had an additive quality that made it impossible not to dance.
meanings.sent5: The additive nature of her smile brightened up the room instantly.

meanings.definition: A number or quantity added to another to form a sum.
meanings.sent1: In math class, the teacher explained how to find the sum by using an additive.
meanings.sent2: The accountant carefully calculated each additive to ensure the total was correct.
meanings.sent3: The additive of extra time allowed him to finish the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an additive that brought joy to the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The additive of love made their bond even stronger.
